instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3209: What is 820-3209? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A No track pad or keyboard
threads.message: No signs of liquid damage, Have used a known good track pad. I know this model only uses USB not SPI so should be fixable . Should i check voltages on J5700 with track pad connected? Any known common issues here?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A No track pad or keyboard
threads.message:
First check L5720 and <RESISTOR>R5730</RESISTOR>.
Also check <RESISTOR>R5704</RESISTOR> and <CHIP>U5700</CHIP> area.
If all OK, I recommend you to test known good TP flex.
Don't trust new chinese flex, try more...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A No track pad or keyboard
threads.message: All those are good area is very clean, Could it just be a bad <CHIP>U5700</CHIP>? have tested with known working TP and TP cable.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A No track pad or keyboard
threads.message: Is the last remaining to test, change it.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A No track pad or keyboard
threads.message: Replaced it with no change. It will do a SMC reset but not PRAM reset. Any other suggestions?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A No track pad or keyboard
threads.message:
<CHIP>U5700</CHIP> is not involved in SMC reset.

Check <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> signal.
Did you try the MLB alone, disconnecting LIO flex?
